issue_description: A qualified electrician should further evaluate the breaker size compared to the gauge of wire. For example, there is a 40-amp breaker powering a 10-gauge wire. This breaker is also "double-tapped" with an 8-gauge stranded wire, which is generally not permitted.
issue_summary: Oversized breaker (40-amp) on 10-gauge wire with double-tapped connections.
additional_information: Equipment overheating and fire hazard risk. Located in electrical panel in basement. Task: Further evaluation. Time: Immediate.

issue_description: The exhaust vent installation for the gas fireplace is incomplete and this will allow hazardous combustion gases into the home if used. This can be a life safety issue. A technician will need to evaluate the installation compared to the manufacturer's installation requirements and make corrections before this fireplace can be safely used.
issue_summary: Incomplete exhaust vent installation on gas fireplace creating life safety hazard.
additional_information: Life safety issue due to potential combustion gas infiltration. Located in basement. Task: Correct. Time: Before use.

issue_description: Missing, loose or torn shingles noted on roof.
additional_information: Chance of water damage to structure, finishes and contents. Location: Roof. Task: Repair. Time: As soon as possible.

issue_description: This window is at grade level. To reduce the potential for damage, a window well should be installed. Efforts should be made to keep water/snow away from the window until corrections are made. A window well cover can be a temporary proactive measure.
issue_summary: Grade-level window lacks proper window well protection.
additional_information: Chance of water damage to structure, finishes and contents. Material deterioration risk. Location: Exterior. Task: Install window well. Time: As soon as reasonably practical.

issue_description: A joist has been notched to accommodate the bathtub plumbing trap. A bathtub can have significant weight when filled with water. A qualified contractor should advise on the appropriate repair method to re-support the joist.
issue_summary: Floor joist compromised by notching for bathtub plumbing installation.
additional_information: Weakened structure concern due to bathtub load capacity. Location: Basement. Task: Repair. Time: As soon as possible.

issue_description: The attic insulation is lower than current standards. Increasing insulation is considered a discretionary improvement that may improve comfort and lower energy bills. Check your eligibility for any home efficiency rebates.
additional_information: Increased heating and cooling costs. Location: Attic. Task: Improve. Time: Discretionary.

issue_description: Residential traps should be P-type. The current waste plumbing installation (including the dishwasher connection downstream of the trap) should be evaluated by a qualified plumber and corrected. Monitor for odors that may indicate siphoning allowing sewer gases to enter the home.
issue_summary: Kitchen sink has nonstandard trap configuration with improper dishwasher connection.
additional_information: Reduced operability and fixtures slow to drain. Potential sewer gas infiltration. Location: Kitchen. Task: Correct. Time: As soon as reasonably practical.

issue_description: The stain was checked with a moisture meter after running water in the bathroom above and did not have elevated levels at the time of the inspection. After repairs (i.e. painting) are completed, inspect the area periodically for any changes.
issue_summary: Water stain present on living room ceiling below bathroom.
additional_information: No current moisture detected but requires monitoring. Chance of water damage to structure, finishes and contents. Location: Living Room. Task: Repair, Monitor for future correction. Time: Ongoing (periodically following repairs).
